import MethodEndpoint from "@theme/ApiExplorer/MethodEndpoint";
import ParamsDetails from "@theme/ParamsDetails";

<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Get Filter Set Values"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"get"}
  path={"/api/v1.0/filters/sets/{filterId}/values"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Returns the list of values assigned to a filter set, typically representing the concrete selections behind saved views, rules, or app criteria. Use this endpoint to hydrate filter chips, rebuild search payloads, or audit what a filter set actually selects.

**Prerequisites**
1. **filterId** - Use [GET /api/v1.0/filters/sets/for/type/\{FilterSetType\}](/docs/api/filters/get-filter-sets-by-type) or [POST /api/v1.0/filters/sets/ids/get](/docs/api/filters/get-filter-sets-by-ids) to obtain a filter set ID.

**Workflow Example**
1. Identify the filter set you need to inspect and capture its ID.
2. Retrieve the stored values: [GET /api/v1.0/filters/sets/\{filterId\}/values](/docs/api/filters/get-filter-set-values).
3. If labels are needed, resolve each `FilterId` + `Value` with [POST /api/v1.0/filters/label/\{filterId\}/values](/docs/api/filters/create-filter-by-id).

**Minimal Required Fields**: filterId (path).

  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}

>

  parameters={[{"name":"filterId","in":"path","required":true,"schema":{"type":"string","format":"uuid"},"description":"The filterId parameter"}]}
>
  
</ParamsDetails>

  title={"Body"}
  body={undefined}
>
  
</RequestSchema>
